channel.title: Comments on: Retrogasmic 1.1 – Your Adventure Begins Here
channel.description: Scattered pages from an apocryphal diary

item.title: By: Drey
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description: I’m closing comments here to encourage people to leave comments on the Secure Immaturity site.
item.content:encoded: I’m closing comments here to encourage people to leave comments on the Secure Immaturity site.

item.title: By: Drey
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description: Jeff, I know we IMed briefly about Maze, but I'd like to know your thoughts. even after all these years, I'll still pick it up and wander through it. I wish there was a sequel or something else like it.
item.content:encoded: Jeff, I know we IMed briefly about Maze, but I’d like to know your thoughts. even after all these years, I’ll still pick it up and wander through it. I wish there was a sequel or something else like it.

item.title: By: Drey
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description: HPunster: Yeah, the cover for Warlock of Firetop Mountain was the newer reprint. The originals were similar in appearance to the CYOA books: white cover, red lettering, and a large painted illustration. There were tons of the Fighting Fantasy books, so you might indeed have had a huge collection.
item.content:encoded: HPunster: Yeah, the cover for Warlock of Firetop Mountain was the newer reprint. The originals were similar in appearance to the CYOA books: white cover, red lettering, and a large painted illustration. There were tons of the Fighting Fantasy books, so you might indeed have had a huge collection.

item.title: By: HPunster
item.dc:creator: HPunster
item.description: I totally LOVED those Fighting Fantasy Books. I've never heard of Sorcery! books, and I think by the time I saw the Lone Wolf books I was either finished with the genre, or concentrating on the FF books. I feel like there was another large series, that I had all the books for. Maybe it was FF, but the cover you showed must be a reprint. Did FF go over 40 books? Because I had a metric buttload of CYOA-type books. Now I'm gonna rack my brains until I think of it. Maybe I gave them to my nephew...
item.content:encoded: I totally LOVED those Fighting Fantasy Books. I’ve never heard of Sorcery! books, and I think by the time I saw the Lone Wolf books I was either finished with the genre, or concentrating on the FF books. I feel like there was another large series, that I had all the books for. Maybe it was FF, but the cover you showed must be a reprint. Did FF go over 40 books? Because I had a metric buttload of CYOA-type books. Now I’m gonna rack my brains until I think of it. Maybe I gave them to my nephew…

item.title: By: Jeff
item.dc:creator: Jeff
item.description:
Great article! I look forward to your next one.
I remember long ago reading a paper you worked on in school on interactive fiction. You definitely have a lot of interesting thoughts on the topic.
I have never heard of Maze before... but after hearing your brief praise (and checking it out on Amazon) I purchased a copy.
item.content:encoded:
Great article! I look forward to your next one.

I remember long ago reading a paper you worked on in school on interactive fiction. You definitely have a lot of interesting thoughts on the topic.

I have never heard of Maze before… but after hearing your brief praise (and checking it out on Amazon) I purchased a copy.
